Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can include at least one land habitat in their drawing, such as a playground, garden, or forest.
The student can include at least one water habitat, such as a pond, stream, or lake.
The student can show different types of living things that belong to each habitat, such as trees, grasses, or flowering plants.
The student can draw animals found in each habitat, like lizards, squirrels, or fish.
The student can compare by showing some differences in the types of plants and animals between different habitats.
The student can demonstrate an understanding of patterns by showing commonalities between similar plants or animals within a habitat.
